location: Milan. Outside the DUKEs palace, under SILVIAs chamber.

lines.text: Enter PROTEUS

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Already have I been false to Valentine And now I must be as unjust to Thurio. Under the colour of commending him, I have access my own love to prefer: But Silvia is too fair, too true, too holy, To be corrupted with my worthless gifts. When I protest true loyalty to her, She twits me with my falsehood to my friend When to her beauty I commend my vows, She bids me think how I have been forsworn In breaking faith with Julia whom I loved: And notwithstanding all her sudden quips, The least whereof would quell a lovers hope, Yet, spaniellike, the more she spurns my love, The more it grows and fawneth on her still. But here comes Thurio: now must we to her window, And give some evening music to her ear.
Enter THURIO and Musicians

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: How now, Sir Proteus, are you crept before us

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Ay, gentle Thurio: for you know that love Will creep in service where it cannot go.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: Ay, but I hope, sir, that you love not here.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Sir, but I do or else I would be hence.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: Who Silvia

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Ay, Silvia for your sake.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: I thank you for your own. Now, gentlemen, Lets tune, and to it lustily awhile.
Enter, at a distance, Host, and JULIA in boys clothes

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Now, my young guest, methinks youre allycholly: I pray you, why is it

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Marry, mine host, because I cannot be merry.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Come, well have you merry: Ill bring you where you shall hear music and see the gentleman that you asked for.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: But shall I hear him speak

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Ay, that you shall.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: That will be music.
Music plays

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Hark, hark!

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Is he among these

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Ay: but, peace! lets hear em. SONG. Who is Silvia what is she, That all our swains commend her Holy, fair and wise is she The heaven such grace did lend her, That she might admired be. Is she kind as she is fair For beauty lives with kindness. Love doth to her eyes repair, To help him of his blindness, And, being helpd, inhabits there. Then to Silvia let us sing, That Silvia is excelling She excels each mortal thing Upon the dull earth dwelling: To her let us garlands bring. How now! are you sadder than you were before How do you, man the music likes you not.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: You mistake the musician likes me not.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Why, my pretty youth

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: He plays false, father.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: How out of tune on the strings

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Not so but yet so false that he grieves my very heartstrings.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: You have a quick ear.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Ay, I would I were deaf it makes me have a slow heart.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: I perceive you delight not in music.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Not a whit, when it jars so.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Hark, what fine change is in the music!

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Ay, that change is the spite.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: You would have them always play but one thing

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: I would always have one play but one thing. But, host, doth this Sir Proteus that we talk on Often resort unto this gentlewoman

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: I tell you what Launce, his man, told me: he loved her out of all nick.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Where is Launce

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Gone to seek his dog which tomorrow, by his masters command, he must carry for a present to his lady.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Peace! stand aside: the company parts.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Sir Thurio, fear not you: I will so plead That you shall say my cunning drift excels.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: Where meet we

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: At Saint Gregorys well.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: Farewell.
Exeunt THURIO and Musicians
Enter SILVIA above

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Madam, good even to your ladyship.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: I thank you for your music, gentlemen. Who is that that spake

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: One, lady, if you knew his pure hearts truth, You would quickly learn to know him by his voice.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: Sir Proteus, as I take it.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Sir Proteus, gentle lady, and your servant.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: Whats your will

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: That I may compass yours.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: You have your wish my will is even this: That presently you hie you home to bed. Thou subtle, perjured, false, disloyal man! Thinkst thou I am so shallow, so conceitless, To be seduced by thy flattery, That hast deceived so many with thy vows Return, return, and make thy love amends. For me, by this pale queen of night I swear, I am so far from granting thy request That I despise thee for thy wrongful suit, And by and by intend to chide myself Even for this time I spend in talking to thee.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: I grant, sweet love, that I did love a lady But she is dead.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: [Aside]        Twere false, if I should speak it For I am sure she is not buried.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: Say that she be yet Valentine thy friend Survives to whom, thyself art witness, I am betrothd: and art thou not ashamed To wrong him with thy importunacy

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: I likewise hear that Valentine is dead.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: And so suppose am I for in his grave Assure thyself my love is buried.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Sweet lady, let me rake it from the earth.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: Go to thy ladys grave and call hers thence, Or, at the least, in hers sepulchre thine.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: [Aside]  He heard not that.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Madam, if your heart be so obdurate, Vouchsafe me yet your picture for my love, The picture that is hanging in your chamber To that Ill speak, to that Ill sigh and weep: For since the substance of your perfect self Is else devoted, I am but a shadow And to your shadow will I make true love.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: [Aside]  If twere a substance, you would, sure, deceive it, And make it but a shadow, as I am.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: I am very loath to be your idol, sir But since your falsehood shall become you well To worship shadows and adore false shapes, Send to me in the morning and Ill send it: And so, good rest.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: As wretches have oernight That wait for execution in the morn.
Exeunt PROTEUS and SILVIA severally

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Host, will you go

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: By my halidom, I was fast asleep.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Pray you, where lies Sir Proteus

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Marry, at my house. Trust me, I think tis almost day.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Not so but it hath been the longest night That eer I watchd and the most heaviest.
Exeunt
